decision_reasoning: refusal of leave to appeal was reasonable and adequately reasoned
application_details: Ms. Monk failed to meet the minimum qualifying period due to insufficient contributions before 2001. Her earnings in 2003-2004 were consistent with her past income, indicating she was not disabled in 2001. No medical evidence supported her claim of inability to work in 2001.
cause_of_action: Ms. Monk applied for a disability pension but lacked sufficient contributions before 2001 due to non-deduction of CPP by her employer.
procedure_followed: Review Tribunal dismissed her appeal; leave to appeal to Pension Appeals Board was refused; judicial review followed.
result_of_case: Judicial review dismissed; no costs awarded.
